meanings.definition: In a way that is impossible to resist or control.
meanings.sent1: She checked her phone compulsively, unable to resist the urge.
meanings.sent2: He compulsively bit his nails whenever he was nervous.
meanings.sent3: The cat compulsively chased after the laser pointer, thinking it was a real prey.
meanings.sent4: The detective compulsively searched for clues, determined to solve the case.
meanings.sent5: The toddler compulsively pressed all the buttons on the toy, fascinated by the sounds it made.

meanings.definition: In a way that is done out of compulsion or necessity.
meanings.sent1: She cleaned the house compulsively before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: He compulsively organized his desk every morning before starting work.
meanings.sent3: The student compulsively checked the clock during the exam, worried about running out of time.
meanings.sent4: The chef compulsively tasted the sauce to ensure it was perfectly seasoned.
meanings.sent5: The athlete compulsively practiced his moves, striving for perfection in every performance.
